page.title: 17THE HIGHAM FERRERS' RAILWAY
page.content:
A railway was built from the Midland main line to Higham Ferrers in 1890. The station master had to send 20lbs of walnuts annually to the St. Pancras Hotel London from a tree still growing in Higham Ferrers. The passenger line was closed in 1959 and 10 years later the line was dismantled.
Nowadays the railway line is used as a footpath and motorbike track. The local scout group have their scout hut on the line. The line which is overgrown is ideal for nature watchers, however some people spoil it by dumping rubbish.
Factories have been built and are still being built on the site of the old railway.
